review: The Amazon Fire TV Stick always show my network with a full signal, but it still keeps loosing connection. All of my apps perform better on my smart TV. A lot of the Amazon Fire TV Stick Apps, such as the History Channel, ask for proof of your cable provider for full access to their app, but they don't even have the two main providers in my area on their list; Comcast and Direct TV. I will take it with me on vacation in two months, see if I have any use for it there.
author: Brian K.

review: Cant even use it. it keeps dropping the wifi signal. The router is fine, and my other devices picks it up just fine. I never got to watch anything on it. I havent found the time to return it. But thats my next step. I wanted to upgrade from my apple tv since it gave out on me. But i guess i'll just get another apple tv since it didnt disappoint me.
author: Michael S.

review: I love the Fire stick. It's very fast and the picture is crystal clear and there is a ton of available content. Between HBOGo, Showtime Anywhere, Prime video, and Netflix I have everything I need. I have a Chromecast and the Fire stick is superior hands down. The Android app is great and even though it's nice having a remote, the app is all I need.
